content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>Repository Bridge Project</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/179" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle>Items relating to the Repository Bridge Project</subtitle> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/179</id> <updated>2015-03-19T06:35:51Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-19T06:35:51Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>Using OAI-PMH and METS for exporting metadata and digital objects between repositories</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/203" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Bell, Jonathan</name> </author> <author> <name>Lewis, Stuart</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/203</id> <updated>2006-08-01T01:00:04Z</updated> <published>2006-01-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Using OAI-PMH and METS for exporting metadata and digital objects between repositories Bell, Jonathan; Lewis, Stuart Purpose \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd To examine the relationship between deposit of electronic theses in institutional and archival repositories. Specifically the paper considers the automated export of theses for deposit in the archival repository in continuation of the existing arrangement in Wales for paper-based theses.   Design/methodology/approach \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The paper presents a description of software that makes use of the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH) as the first stage in the automatic import and ingest of items between institutional and archival repositories. The implications of this approach on the management of the institutional repository are also considered.   Findings \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The paper shows that OAI-PMH is a useful approach to harvesting the metadata for items to be imported into an archival repository. This reduces the difficulty of maintenance of the import and export software components albeit at the possible expense of necessitating certain requirements on the management of the institutional repository.   Research implications/limitations \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The research shows that institutions can make use of OAI-PMH as a part of an automated export/import process, encouraging the preservation of multiple copies of digital items for increased safety of the content.   Practical implications \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The software has been developed and is being tested. It is proving capable of performing the required harvesting but the relative imprecision of searching in OAI-PMH has implications for the management of the exporting repository. These are discussed.   Originality/value \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The paper presents a description and discussion of novel software components that enable the use of OAI-PMH as the first stage in the export and import of digital items between repositories, independently (as far as is practicable) of the software used by the repositories themselves.    Article Type: Technical paper  Keyword(s): Digital libraries; Theses; Wales. </summary> <dc:date>2006-01-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Presentations from the Repository Bridge publicity events</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/202" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Lewis, Stuart</name> </author> <author> <name>Bell, Jonathan</name> </author> <author> <name>Wolf, Martin</name> </author> <author> <name>Tedd, Lucy A.</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/202</id> <updated>2006-08-19T06:41:02Z</updated> <published>2006-07-28T13:16:13Z</published> <summary type="text">Presentations from the Repository Bridge publicity events Lewis, Stuart; Bell, Jonathan; Wolf, Martin; Tedd, Lucy A. Presentations from the Repository Bridge publicity events run on the 26th July 2006 in Bangor and the 3rd August 2006 in Cardiff. </summary> <dc:date>2006-07-28T13:16:13Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Exposing METS through OAI-PMH for DSpace</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/180" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Bell, Jonathan</name> </author> <author> <name>Lewis, Stuart</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/180</id> <updated>2006-07-11T15:54:38Z</updated> <published>2006-06-28T10:36:49Z</published> <summary type="text">Exposing METS through OAI-PMH for DSpace Bell, Jonathan; Lewis, Stuart Copy the jar file into your lib directory and enter the following text into [dspace]/config/oiacat.properties  "Crosswalks.mets=uk.ac.aber.inf.bridge.METSCrosswalk"  Finally, restart tomcat. Contact sdl@aber.ac.uk for further details. </summary> <dc:date>2006-06-28T10:36:49Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
